TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataGridViewImageCellLayout extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the layout for an image contained in a .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example illustrates the use of this type. This example is part of a larger example available in [How to: Work with Image Columns in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](../Topic/How%20to:%20Work%20with%20Image%20Columns%20in%20the%20Windows%20Forms%20DataGridView%20Control.md).
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ImageColumn_TicTacToe#20](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.windows.forms.d_113_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ImageColumn_TicTacToe#20](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.windows.forms.d_113_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ImageColumn_TicTacToe#20](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.windows.forms.d_113_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewImageCellLayout Normal = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The graphic is displayed centered using its native resolution.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewImageCellLayout NotSet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The layout specification has not been set.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewImageCellLayout Stretch = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The graphic is stretched by the percentages required to fit the width and height of the containing cell.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewImageCellLayout Zoom = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The graphic is uniformly enlarged until it fills the width or height of the containing cell.
